intro: Reichertia, commonly known as the "cabbage tree," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its tall, woody stems and compound leaves. The plants typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to dry, coastal environments. Reichertia species produce small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. These plants are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and hardy nature.
